category: General Assembly of Representatives and Board of Directors Regulations/Article 16 (Voting)
contents: Article 16 (Voting) ① When the discussion is concluded, the chairperson shall vote on the motions and various amendments made during the discussion. ② Immediately after declaring a vote, the Chairman shall inquire at the general meeting about the voting method and have it determined by the general meeting. However, this does not apply when otherwise provided by the Articles of Incorporation or regulations. ③ Once the voting method is decided, all motions must be voted on in order, starting from the final amendment motion and ending with the original motion. However, when either the motion or the amendment motion is unanimously voted on, the vote on the remaining motions may be omitted. ④ A vote will be passed only when the quorum stipulated in Article 19 of the Articles of Incorporation is reached, and if this is not reached, it will be rejected. ⑤ The chairman must confirm the voting results and declare the approval or rejection to the general meeting.
